channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: México: Los DJs de cumbia del barrio
item.description: Uno de los géneros más escuchados en las Américas, los fotógrafos Karla Gachet e Iván Kashinsky documentan la cumbia en Colombia, México, Ecuador, Perú, Argentina y Estados Unidos.
item.content:encoded:
Uno de los géneros más escuchados en las Américas, los fotógrafos Karla Gachet e Iván Kashinsky documentan la cumbia en Colombia, México, Ecuador, Perú, Argentina y Estados Unidos.

(Image credit: Ivan Kashinsky)
item.dc:creator: Karla Gachet

item.title: Mexico: The cumbia DJs of the streets
item.description: One of the most listened-to genres in the Americas, photographers and storytellers Karla Gachet and Ivan Kashinsky document cumbia in Colombia, Mexico, Ecuador, Peru, Argentina and the United States.
item.content:encoded:
One of the most listened-to genres in the Americas, photographers and storytellers Karla Gachet and Ivan Kashinsky document cumbia in Colombia, Mexico, Ecuador, Peru, Argentina and the United States.

(Image credit: Ivan Kashinsky)
item.dc:creator: Karla Gachet

item.title: Shutdown postpones monthly jobs report. And, Trump dangles a carrot to colleges
item.description: The government shutdown has delayed the monthly jobs report. And, the White House pressures colleges to sign a 'compact' aligning with Trump's agenda.
item.content:encoded:
The government shutdown has delayed the monthly jobs report. And, the White House pressures colleges to sign a 'compact' aligning with Trump's agenda.

(Image credit: Mehmet Eser/Middle East Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: AI's getting better at faking crowds. Here's why that's cause for concern
item.description: Odd fingers and faces in the crowd of a recent Will Smith concert video led to suspicions of AI. But AI is improving fast, and there are serious implications for how "fake" crowds might be coopted.
item.content:encoded:
for its new video generation platform Sora 2. AI crowd scenes have traditionally posed a big technical challenge for companies like OpenAI and Google. But their models are improving all the time.'/>

Odd fingers and faces in the crowd of a recent Will Smith concert video led to suspicions of AI. But AI is improving fast, and there are serious implications for how "fake" crowds might be coopted.

(Image credit: OpenAI)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Sarah Mullally named first woman Archbishop of Canterbury
item.description: Sarah Mullally has been named as the new Archbishop of Canterbury, becoming the first woman to be chosen to lead the world's 85 million Anglicans.
item.content:encoded:
Sarah Mullally has been named as the new Archbishop of Canterbury, becoming the first woman to be chosen to lead the world's 85 million Anglicans.

(Image credit: Ian West)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: One of 2 victims in Manchester synagogue attack was accidentally shot by police
item.description: Greater Manchester Police named Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66 as the victims of Thursday's attack. Three more remain hospitalized in serious condition.
item.content:encoded:
Greater Manchester Police named Adrian Daulby, 53, and Melvin Cravitz, 66 as the victims of Thursday's attack. Three more remain hospitalized in serious condition.

(Image credit: Peter Byrne/)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: What to know about former U.K. leader Tony Blair, tapped by Trump for postwar Gaza role
item.description: As Britain's prime minister, Tony Blair succeeded in negotiating peace in Northern Ireland in 1998. Five years later, he joined the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq — sullying his reputation ever since.
item.content:encoded:
As Britain's prime minister, Tony Blair succeeded in negotiating peace in Northern Ireland in 1998. Five years later, he joined the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq — sullying his reputation ever since.

(Image credit: Jack Taylor)
item.dc:creator: Lauren Frayer

item.title: A public broadcaster's path after losing U.S. funds: Youth sports and less local news
item.description: South Dakota Public Broadcasting says there's an ironic result to President Trump's successful attack on public media: It will have to rely more on NPR programs.
item.content:encoded:
South Dakota Public Broadcasting says there's an ironic result to President Trump's successful attack on public media: It will have to rely more on NPR programs.

(Image credit: Kelcey Schroder for NPR)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Even a government shutdown can't stop the quiz. Can you score 11?
item.description: This week's quiz also features bears.
item.content:encoded: This week's quiz also features bears.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Memphis sees opportunity in Trump's plans for federal intervention
item.description: Many in Memphis acknowledge that crime in the city is a real problem. And while President Trump's federal intervention might not be their ideal way to handle it, they're hoping it can provide some much-needed relief.
item.content:encoded:
Many in Memphis acknowledge that crime in the city is a real problem. And while President Trump's federal intervention might not be their ideal way to handle it, they're hoping it can provide some much-needed relief.

(Image credit: Ziggy Mack)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf
